00001 #include <scicos/scicos_block.h>
00002 #include <stdio.h>
00003 #include <unistd.h>
00004 
00005 /* Block encoding function. Nothing hard, simply... It's necessary.
00006  * First output value is an identifier for the request. Simply it tells the
00007  * dispatcher whether the request is to read a sensor (1) or set a motor (2).
00008  * However the output is a two slots array that contains in the first place the
00009  * Sensor type and the second the port number (1 to 4 for sensor ports 1 to 4
00010  * and 5 to 7 for motor ports A to C).
00011  * The Sensor types are:
00012  *
00013  * 1 -> RAW Tacho counter
00014  * 2 -> AVG Speed (computed by the NXT Block)
00015  * 3 -> Light Sensor
00016  * 4 -> Touch Sensor
00017  * 5 -> Sound Sensor
00018  * 6 -> Ultrasonic (Distance) Sensor
00019  */
00020 
00021 void bro_sensor_enc_run (scicos_block *block)
00022 {
00023     block->outptr[0][0] = 1;
00024     block->outptr[0][1] = block->ipar[0];
00025     block->outptr[0][2] = block->ipar[1];
00026     block->outptr[0][3] = 0;
00027 }
00028 
00029 
00030 void bro_sensor_enc (scicos_block *block, int flag)
00031 {
00032         switch (flag) {
00033                 case 1: /* set output */
00034                     bro_sensor_enc_run(block);
00035                     break;
00036                 case 2: /* get input */
00037                         break;
00038                 case 4: /* initialisation */
00039                 break;
00040                 case 5: /* ending */
00041                         break;
00042             default:
00043                 break;
00044         }
00045 }
